intro: Henriettea stellaris, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other notable species like willowherb and evening primrose. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. Henriettea stellaris thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. Its botanical features make it a popular subject in horticulture and ecological studies.
